etymologies: modern Latin, from Latin, literally ‘sacred bough’, in medieval Latin ‘vervain’

definitions: a chiefly American herbaceous plant which bears heads of bright showy flowers, widely cultivated as a garden ornamental.

notes.text: Genus Verbena, family Verbenaceae: many species, in particular a group of complex cultivars (V. × hybrida)

shortDefinitions: chiefly American herbaceous plant which bears heads of bright showy flowers
